File: vsip/core/vector.hpp

  2
  3/** @file    vsip/core/vector.hpp
  4    @author  Zack Weinberg
  5    @date    2005-01-24
  6    @brief   VSIPL++ Library: [view.vector] views implementing
  7             one-dimensional vectors.
  8
  9    This file declares the \c const_Vector and \c Vector classes,
 10    which provide the generic View interface, and implement the
 11    mathematical idea of vectors, i.e. one-dimensional storage and
 12    access to values.  A \c const_Vector view is not modifiable, but a
 13    \c Vector view is modifiable.  */
 14
 15#ifndef VSIP_CORE_VECTOR_HPP
 16#define VSIP_CORE_VECTOR_HPP
 17
 18/***********************************************************************
 19  Included Files
 20***********************************************************************/
 21

 26#include <vsip/core/subblock.hpp>
 27#include <vsip/core/expr/scalar_block.hpp>
 28#include <vsip/core/refcount.hpp>
 29#include <vsip/core/noncopyable.hpp>
 30#include <vsip/core/view_traits.hpp>
 31#include <vsip/core/assign.hpp>
 32#include <vsip/core/lvalue_proxy.hpp>
 33#include <vsip/core/block_fill.hpp>
 34#ifndef VSIP_IMPL_REF_IMPL
 35# include <vsip_csl/pi/iterator.hpp>
 36#endif

 39  Declarations

 42namespace vsip
 43{
 44
 45/// View which appears as a one-dimensional, read-only vector.
 46template <typename T, typename Block>
 47class const_Vector : public impl::Non_assignable,
 48		     public vsip::impl_const_View<vsip::const_Vector,Block>
 49{
 50  typedef vsip::impl_const_View<vsip::const_Vector,Block> impl_base_type;
 51  typedef typename impl::Lvalue_factory_type<Block>::type impl_factory_type;
 52
 53public:
 54  // Compile-time values.
 55  static dimension_type const dim = 1;
 56  typedef Block                                       block_type;
 57  typedef typename block_type::value_type             value_type;
 58  typedef typename impl_factory_type::reference_type  reference_type;
 59  typedef typename impl_factory_type::const_reference_type
 60		const_reference_type;
 61
 62protected:
 63  typedef typename block_type::map_type  impl_map_type;
 64  typedef impl::Subset_block<block_type> impl_subblock_type;
 65
 66public:
 67  // [view.vector.subview_types]
 68  typedef const_Vector<T, impl_subblock_type> subview_type;
 69  typedef const_Vector<T, impl_subblock_type> const_subview_type;
 70
 71  typedef typename impl_base_type::impl_const_view_type impl_const_view_type;
 72
 73  // [view.vector.constructors]
 74
 75  const_Vector(length_type len, T const& value,
 76	       impl_map_type const& map = impl_map_type())
 77    : impl_base_type(new block_type(Domain<1>(len), value, map),
 78		     impl::noincrement)
 79  {}
 80  explicit const_Vector(length_type len,
 81			impl_map_type const& map = impl_map_type())
 82    : impl_base_type(new block_type(Domain<1>(len), map), impl::noincrement)
 83  {}
 84  const_Vector(Block& blk) VSIP_NOTHROW
 85    : impl_base_type (&blk)
 86  {}
 87  const_Vector(const_Vector const& v) VSIP_NOTHROW
 88    : impl_base_type(&v.block())
 89  { impl::expr::evaluate(this->block());}
 90  ~const_Vector() VSIP_NOTHROW
 91  {}
 92
 93  // [view.vector.valaccess]
 94  value_type get(index_type i) const VSIP_NOTHROW
 95  {
 96    assert(i < this->size(0));
 97    return this->block().get(i);
 98  }
 99
100  // Supported for some, but not all, underlying Blocks.
101  const_reference_type operator()(index_type i) const VSIP_NOTHROW
102  {
103    assert(i < this->size(0));
104    impl_factory_type f(this->block());
105    return f.impl_ref(i);
106  }
107
108  // [view.vector.subviews]
109  const_subview_type
110  get(Domain<1> const& dom) const VSIP_THROW((std::bad_alloc))
111  {
112    impl_subblock_type block(dom, this->block());
113    return const_subview_type(block);
114  }
115  const_subview_type
116  operator()(Domain<1> const& dom) const VSIP_THROW((std::bad_alloc))
117  {
118    impl_subblock_type block(dom, this->block());
119    return const_subview_type(block);
120  }
121#ifndef VSIP_IMPL_REF_IMPL
122  template <int I>
123  vsip_csl::pi::Call<block_type, vsip_csl::pi::Iterator<I> >
124  operator()(vsip_csl::pi::Iterator<I> i)
125  {
126    using namespace vsip_csl::pi;
127    return Call<block_type, Iterator<I> >(this->block(), i);
128  }
129#endif
130
131  // [view.vector.accessors]
132  length_type length() const VSIP_NOTHROW
133    { return this->block().size(); }
134};
135
136
137
138#define VSIP_IMPL_ELEMENTWISE_SCALAR(op)        		   \
139  *this = *this op val
140
141#define VSIP_IMPL_ELEMENTWISE_SCALAR_NOFWD(op)			   \
142  for (index_type i = 0; i < this->size(); i++)			   \
143    this->put(i, this->get(i) op val)
144
145#define VSIP_IMPL_ELEMENTWISE_VECTOR(op)	                   \
146  *this = *this op v;
147
148#define VSIP_IMPL_ELEMENTWISE_VECTOR_NOFWD(op)			   \
149  for (index_type i = (assert(this->size() == v.size()), 0);	   \
150       i < this->size(); i++)					   \
151    this->put(i, this->get(i) op v.get(i))
152  
153#define VSIP_IMPL_ASSIGN_OP(asop, op)			   	   \
154  template <typename T0>                                           \
155  Vector& operator asop(T0 const& val) VSIP_NOTHROW                \
156  { VSIP_IMPL_ELEMENTWISE_SCALAR(op); return *this;}               \
157  template <typename T0, typename Block0>                          \
158  Vector& operator asop(const_Vector<T0, Block0> v) VSIP_NOTHROW  \
159  { VSIP_IMPL_ELEMENTWISE_VECTOR(op); return *this;}               \
160  template <typename T0, typename Block0>                          \
161  Vector& operator asop(const Vector<T0, Block0> v) VSIP_NOTHROW  \
162  { VSIP_IMPL_ELEMENTWISE_VECTOR(op); return *this;}
163
164#define VSIP_IMPL_ASSIGN_OP_NOFWD(asop, op)			   \
165  template <typename T0>                                           \
166  Vector& operator asop(T0 const& val) VSIP_NOTHROW                \
167  { VSIP_IMPL_ELEMENTWISE_SCALAR_NOFWD(op); return *this;}	   \
168  template <typename T0, typename Block0>                          \
169  Vector& operator asop(const_Vector<T0, Block0> v) VSIP_NOTHROW   \
170  { VSIP_IMPL_ELEMENTWISE_VECTOR_NOFWD(op); return *this;}	   \
171  template <typename T0, typename Block0>                          \
172  Vector& operator asop(const Vector<T0, Block0> v) VSIP_NOTHROW   \
173  { VSIP_IMPL_ELEMENTWISE_VECTOR_NOFWD(op); return *this;}
174
175
176/// View which appears as a one-dimensional, modifiable vector.  This
177/// inherits from const_Vector, so only the members that const_Vector
178/// does not carry, or that are different, need be specified.
179template <typename T, typename Block>
180class Vector : public vsip::impl_View<vsip::Vector,Block>
181{
182  typedef vsip::impl_View<vsip::Vector,Block> impl_base_type;
183  typedef typename impl::Lvalue_factory_type<Block>::type impl_factory_type;
184
185public:
186  // Compile-time values.
187  static dimension_type const dim = 1;
188  typedef Block                                      block_type;
189  typedef typename block_type::value_type            value_type;
190  typedef typename impl_factory_type::reference_type reference_type;
191  typedef typename impl_factory_type::const_reference_type
192		const_reference_type;
193
194private:
195  // Implementation compile-time values.
196  typedef typename block_type::map_type             impl_map_type;
197
198  // [view.vector.subview_types]
199  // Override subview_type and make it writable.
200  typedef impl::Subset_block<block_type> impl_subblock_type;
201
202public:
203  typedef Vector<T, impl_subblock_type>      subview_type;
204
205  // [view.vector.constructors]
206  Vector(length_type len, T const& value,
207	 impl_map_type const& map = impl_map_type())
208    : impl_base_type(len, value, map, impl::disambiguate)
209  {}
210  explicit Vector(length_type len,
211	          impl_map_type const& map = impl_map_type())
212    : impl_base_type(len, map)
213  {}
214  Vector(Block& blk) VSIP_NOTHROW
215    : impl_base_type(blk)
216  {}
217  Vector(Vector const& v) VSIP_NOTHROW
218    : impl_base_type(v.block())
219  {}
220  template <typename T0, typename Block0>
221  Vector(const_Vector<T0, Block0> const& v) VSIP_NOTHROW
222    : impl_base_type(v.length(), v.block().map())
223  { *this = v; }
224  ~Vector() VSIP_NOTHROW
225  {}
226
227  // [view.vector.valaccess]
228  void put(index_type i, value_type val) const VSIP_NOTHROW
229  {
230    assert(i < this->size(0));
231    this->block().put(i, val);
232  }
233
234  reference_type operator()(index_type i) VSIP_NOTHROW
235  {
236    assert(i < this->size(0));
237    impl_factory_type f(this->block());
238    return f.impl_ref(i);
239  }
240
241  template <typename T0, typename Block0>
242  Vector(Vector<T0, Block0> const& v)
243    : impl_base_type(v.size(), impl_map_type())
244  { *this = v; }
245
246  Vector& operator=(Vector const& v) VSIP_NOTHROW
247  {
248    assert(this->size() == v.size());
249    impl::assign<1>(this->block(), v.block());
250    return *this;
251  }
252
253  Vector& operator=(const_reference_type val) VSIP_NOTHROW
254  {
255    impl::expr::Scalar<1, T> scalar(val);
256    impl::assign<1>(this->block(), scalar);
257    return *this;
258  }
259  template <typename T0>
260  Vector& operator=(T0 const& val) VSIP_NOTHROW
261  {
262    impl::expr::Scalar<1, T0> scalar(val);
263    impl::assign<1>(this->block(), scalar);
264    return *this;
265  }
266  template <typename T0, typename Block0>
267  Vector& operator=(const_Vector<T0, Block0> const& v) VSIP_NOTHROW
268  {
269    assert(this->size() == v.size());
270    impl::assign<1>(this->block(), v.block());
271    return *this;
272  }
273  template <typename T0, typename Block0>
274  Vector& operator=(Vector<T0, Block0> const& v) VSIP_NOTHROW
275  {
276    assert(this->size() == v.size());
277    impl::assign<1>(this->block(), v.block());
278    return *this;
279  }
280
281  // [view.vector.subviews]
282  subview_type
283  operator()(Domain<1> const& dom) VSIP_THROW((std::bad_alloc))
284  {
285    impl_subblock_type block(dom, this->block());
286    return subview_type(block);
287  }
288#ifndef VSIP_IMPL_REF_IMPL
289  template <int I>
290  vsip_csl::pi::Call<block_type, vsip_csl::pi::Iterator<I> >
291  operator()(vsip_csl::pi::Iterator<I> const &i)
292  {
293    using namespace vsip_csl::pi;
294    return Call<block_type, Iterator<I> >(this->block(), i);
295  }
296#endif
297
298  // [view.vector.assign]
299  VSIP_IMPL_ASSIGN_OP(+=, +)
300  VSIP_IMPL_ASSIGN_OP(-=, -)
301  VSIP_IMPL_ASSIGN_OP(*=, *)
302  VSIP_IMPL_ASSIGN_OP(/=, /)
303  // ghs claims the use of operator& in 'view1 & view2' is ambiguous,
304  // thus we implement operator&= in terms of the scalar operator&.
305  // Likewise for operator=| and operator=^.
306  VSIP_IMPL_ASSIGN_OP_NOFWD(&=, &)
307  VSIP_IMPL_ASSIGN_OP_NOFWD(|=, |)
308  VSIP_IMPL_ASSIGN_OP_NOFWD(^=, ^)
309
310};
311
312#undef VSIP_IMPL_ASSIGN_OP
313#undef VSIP_IMPL_ELEMENTWISE_SCALAR
314#undef VSIP_IMPL_ELEMENTWISE_VECTOR
315#undef VSIP_IMPL_ASSIGN_OP_NOFWD
316#undef VSIP_IMPL_ELEMENTWISE_SCALAR_NOFWD
317#undef VSIP_IMPL_ELEMENTWISE_VECTOR_NOFWD
318
319// [view.vector.convert]
320template <typename T, typename Block>
321struct ViewConversion<Vector, T, Block>
322{
323  typedef const_Vector<T, Block> const_view_type;
324  typedef Vector<T, Block> view_type;
325};
326
327template <typename T, typename Block>
328struct ViewConversion<const_Vector, T, Block>
329{
330  typedef const_Vector<T, Block> const_view_type;
331  typedef Vector<T, Block> view_type;
332};
333
334namespace impl
335{
336
337template <typename T,
338	  typename Block>
339struct View_of_dim<1, T, Block>
340{
341  typedef Vector<T, Block>       type;
342  typedef const_Vector<T, Block> const_type;
343};
344
345template <typename T, typename Block> 
346struct Is_view_type<Vector<T, Block> >
347{
348  typedef Vector<T, Block> type;
349  static bool const value = true;
350};
351
352template <typename T, typename Block> 
353struct Is_view_type<const_Vector<T, Block> >
354{
355  typedef const_Vector<T, Block> type;
356  static bool const value = true;
357};
358
359template <typename T, typename Block> 
360struct Is_const_view_type<const_Vector<T, Block> >
361{
362  typedef const_Vector<T, Block> type;
363  static bool const value = true;
364};
365
366template <typename T, typename Block>
367T
368get(const_Vector<T, Block> view, Index<1> const &i)
369{
370  return view.get(i[0]);
371}
372
373template <typename T, typename Block>
374void
375put(Vector<T, Block> view, Index<1> const &i, T value)
376{
377  view.put(i[0], value);
378}
379
380/// Return the view extent as a domain.
381template <typename T,
382	  typename Block>
383inline Domain<1>
384view_domain(const_Vector<T, Block> const& view)
385{
386  return Domain<1>(view.size(0));
387}
388
389/// Get the extent of a vector view, as a Length. 
390template <typename T,
391	  typename Block>
392inline Length<1>
393extent(const_Vector<T, Block> const &v)
394{
395  return Length<1>(v.size(0));
396}
